character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_son_4.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, please share the magnet tiles

character_2_text.eng: But I need them to make my house!

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f3_son_4.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name, please share the magnet tiles
rows.character_2_text: But I need them to make my house!

character_2_text.eng: There are not enough magnet tiles to build two houses.

rows.character_2_text: There are not enough magnet tiles to build two houses.

character_1_text.eng: What do you think we could do to solve this problem?

rows.character_1_text: What do you think we could do to solve this problem?

character_1_text.eng: Excellent idea, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name! Can I help too?

rows.character_1_text: Excellent idea, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name! Can I help too?

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f3_mother.name, @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name and @data.characters.f3_son_4.name worked together to solve their problem.

quiz_1_question.eng: What problem did this family have?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: There were not enough tiles to build two houses

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, the children were fighting because there were not enough tiles for both the children to play individually.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name did not want to play with @data.characters.f3_son_4.name

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: @data.characters.f3_son_4.namel and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7 both wanted to play, but they needed to find a way to share the magnet tiles. The real problem was that there weren’t enough tiles for both to build separate houses.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: The mother wouldn’t let them use the magnet tiles

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: The mother encouraged the children to share the magnet tiles. The main issue was not about permission but about finding a way to use the limited tiles together.

quiz_2_question.eng: What does @data.characters.f3_mother.name do to solve the problem together with her children?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: She builds a house for them using the magnet tiles.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Try again! The mother didn’t take over the building. Instead, she guided @data.characters.f3_son_4.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to think of a solution themselves.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: She tells @data.characters.f3_son_4.name to let @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name have the tiles first.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Incorrect. The mother didn’t tell either child a solution to either child. . She encouraged both children to find a way to solve the problem together.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: She encourages @data.characters.f3_son_4.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to come up with their own solution.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Yes, that’s right.The mother helped solve the problem by encouraging @data.characters.f3_son_4.name and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7.name to think about ways to share and build something together.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Yes, the children were fighting because there were not enough tiles for both the children to play individually.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: @data.characters.f3_son_4.namel and @data.characters.f3_daughter_7 both wanted to play, but they needed to find a way to share the magnet tiles. The real problem was that there weren’t enough tiles for both to build separate houses.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: The mother encouraged the children to share the magnet tiles. The main issue was not about permission but about finding a way to use the limited tiles together.
